arm_group.description: personalized counseling on active use of the built environment

brief_summary.textblock:
The study aims are to develop and test the feasibility of a pediatric physical activity
      intervention that incorporates personal information on use of the built environment, and
      test the intervention's preliminary efficacy at increasing physical activity. The
      investigators hypothesize that it will be feasible to incorporate and measure changes in
      empiric GIS, GPS, and accelerometer feedback in the office setting as demonstrated by: i)
      Completeness of GPS and accelerometer data collection (primary measure of feasibility), ii)
      Participation rates among adolescents in the intervention group compared to the control
      group, and iii) Acceptability to patients as measured by adolescent satisfaction.

clinical_study.brief_title: Children's Use of the Built Environment for Physical Activity

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Adolescents ages 10-16 years

          -  BMI > 85th percentile for age and sex

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Physical conditions impairing ambulation

          -  Adolescents who do not speak English

          -  Adolescents who have missed more than 2 scheduled doctor's appointments during the
             past 5 years

          -  Adolescents who are receiving any other form of physical activity
             counseling/intervention at the time of enrollment

facility.name: Massachusetts General Hospital Revere HealthCare Center

clinical_study.official_title: Use of the Built Environment to Promote Physical Activity in Children.

primary_outcome.description: Physical activity and use of the built environment will be measured at three different time points (pre-intervention/baseline, short term follow-up at 1 week post-counseling, and longer term follow-up at 4 months post-counseling) with an accelerometer and GPS.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Completeness of GPS and accelerometer data provided by participants
Participation rates among adolescents in the intervention group compared to the control group
Acceptability to patients as measured by adolescent satisfaction.

collaborator.agency: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI)

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label
